Description: Fragmentary rim of a large basin (perirrhanterion), carved from greyish-green marble; inscribed; polished surface.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Sammlung des Ägyptologischen Instituts der Universität, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The perirrhanterion is a special type of louterion (water-basin) used for ritual washing in sanctuaries (Pimpl 1997; Krauskopf 2005; cf. also Ginouvès 1962, 77-103; Kurtz and Boardman 1971, 151). Excavations at Naukratis yielded a number of specimens in stone (marble) and in ceramic. Most of the stone examples bear Greek votive dedications to Apollo.
